alert.note: Alert for South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 26 at 10:08PM CST until January 28 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM FRIDAY TO 5 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...A prolonged period of moderate to heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches. Areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Much of Platte and Goshen Counties in southeast Wyoming. Southern Sioux County in the northern Nebraska Panhandle. The highest totals will be found in western Platte County along and west of Interstate 25. * WHEN...11 AM MST Friday until 5 PM MST Saturday. The heaviest snow is expected on Saturday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
